title: Rhonda Wilcox
text:
Rhonda Earlene Wilcox (née Meads; born 3 November 1961) is a former New Zealand <a href="netball">netball</a>er who played for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20netball%20team">New Zealand national team</a>, the Silver Ferns, on 20 occasions.
Early life and family.
Wilcox was born Rhonda Earlene Meads on 3 November 1961, the daughter <a href="Colin%20Meads">Colin</a> and Verna Meads. Her father was a leading <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player in the 1950s and 1960s, representing his country as a member of the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a> in international <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20union%29">test matches</a> on 55 occasions. One of five siblings, Wilcox was raised on a farm on the outskirts of <a href="Te%20Kuiti">Te Kuiti</a> in the <a href="North%20Island">North Island</a> of New Zealand, and educated at <a href="Te%20Kuiti%20High%20School">Te Kuiti High School</a>. Her youngest sister, <a href="Shelley%20Mitchell%20%28basketball%29">Shelley Mitchell</a>, played for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20women%27s%20national%20basketball%20team">New Zealand women's basketball team</a> in 1991 and 1992.
Netball career.
Wilcox was first selected to play for the Silver Ferns in 1982, becoming, with her father, the first All Black–Silver Fern, father–daughter combination. Playing in the goal shooter (GS) position, she was at the time the tallest shooter to play for the team, standing at . In 1982, she toured England, playing her first test match on 13 November. Wilcox played in the <a href="1983%20World%20Netball%20Championships">1983 World Netball Championships</a> in <a href="Singapore">Singapore</a>, where New Zealand lost to Australia in the final. In 1985, at the <a href="Netball%20at%20the%20World%20Games">World Games</a> held in <a href="London">London</a>, she switched to playing as the goal keeper (GK). New Zealand won the gold medal, beating Australia in the final.
After retiring from top-level competition, Wilcox continued to play, including for the Riverlands team in the <a href="Waikato">Waikato</a> region, when she played alongside her sister, Shelley Mitchell.
Later life.
From 1998 to 2016, Wilcox worked as a supply manager for <a href="Air%20New%20Zealand">Air New Zealand</a>. She also occasionally served as a <a href="Scout%20%28sport%29">scout</a> for the Silver Ferns.
